intro: Haworthia lisbonensis, commonly known as the Lisbon Haworthia, is a compact, slow-growing succulent native to South Africa. It features a rosette of thick, fleshy, and often bluish-green leaves with distinctive white or pale markings. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange during the warmer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it ideal for rock gardens or indoor cultivation. Its unique appearance and low maintenance make it a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
